title: Fraser Anderson
text:
Fraser Anderson (born 20 April 1984) is a former professional <a href="rugby%20football">rugby football</a>er who played <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> for the <a href="Kobelco%20Steelers">Kobelco Steelers</a>. Anderson previously played rugby league in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a> for Brisbane and Cronulla-Sutherland.
Background.
Anderson was born in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, New Zealand. Anderson is of <a href="Tongans">Tongan</a> descent.
Early years.
Fraser Anderson attended The <a href="Church%20College%20of%20New%20Zealand">Church College of New Zealand</a>. Anderson is a member of <a href="The%20Church%20of%20Jesus%20Christ%20of%20Latter-day%20Saints">The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints</a> and served for two years as a missionary in <a href="Olongapo">Olongapo</a> in the <a href="Philippines">Philippines</a>.
Rugby league career.
Anderson made his first grade <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> debut for the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> in round 14, 2006 against <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> at <a href="Telstra%20Stadium">Telstra Stadium</a>. Anderson then became a regular in the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a> line up during the 2007 and 2008 seasons, playing either in the centres or the second row. Anderson's final game in the NRL was the 2008 preliminary final match against <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne</a> which Cronulla lost 28–0 at the <a href="Sydney%20Football%20Stadium">Sydney Football Stadium</a>.
Representative career.
Anderson was named in both the <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20squads%23Tonga">Tonga training squad</a> and the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team%232008%20World%20Cup%20Squad">New Zealand training squad</a> for the <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2008 World Cup</a>. He did not make the New Zealand side, but was selected to play for <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20squads%23Tonga">Tonga</a> in the <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">World Cup</a>.
Rugby union career.
On 24 February 2009 it was announced that Anderson had been granted an immediate release from his Sharks contract to take up a two-year contract with <a href="Top%20League">Top League</a> Japanese <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> club, <a href="Kobelco%20Steelers">Kobelco Steelers</a>, worth <a href="Australian%20Dollar">A$</a>400,000 per year.
